ARABIC: وَمَا ظَلَمْنَٰهُمْ وَلَٰكِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We have not wronged them; it was they who were wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We did not wrong them, they wronged themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: It is not We Who wronged them; rather, it is they who wronged themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will cry out, "Guard, let your Lord destroy us".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And We did not oppress them at all, but they themselves were unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: We wronged them not, but they were the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And We are not unjust to them, but they themselves were unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We never wronged them, but they themselves did the wrong.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: We wronged them not, but they it was who did the wrong.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have not wronged them; it was they who were the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We wronged them not, but they have been the wrong- doers themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: We did not wrong them, but they themselves were wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nowise shall We be unjust to them: but it is they who have been unjust themselves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: We wronged them not, but they were the Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We did not wrong them, but they were harmdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We did them no injustice, but it was they who were the unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We did not wrong them, but it was they who were the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:76] And We never wronged them, but they themselves were the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (We wronged them not) by punishing them, (but they it was who did the wrong) by adopting disbelief and idolatry.
